msgSnippet: assertSame passes if the objects given as the arguments are the same. in your case they are not the same object, the simply contain the same text. use

assertSame passes if the objects given as the arguments are the same.
in your case they are not the same object, the simply contain the same text.
use assertTrue(("custName", custName.equals( 
(String)modifiedMap.get(CUST_NAME)) );



>From: aimee.ukasick@...
>Reply-To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [junit] assertSame failure
>Date: Wed, 29 Aug 2001 15:33:18 -0000
>
>Hi!
>In my tests, I'm modifying a value in a HashMap and then making sure
>the value has indeed been modified. If I use "assertSame" the test
>fails, but if I use "assert" it passes. Is this a JUnit (v3.7) bug?
>Has anyone else encountered this?
>
>Fails:
>assertSame("custName" ,custName,(String)modifiedMap.get
>(CONTACT_NAME));
>
>Passes:
>assert("custName", custName.equalsIgnoreCase( (String)modifiedMap.get
>(CUST_NAME)) );
>assert("custName", custName.equals( (String)modifiedMap.get
>(CUST_NAME)) );
>
>
>Aimee Ukasick
>GE Medical Systems
>
